questions.question_text:
DreamHouse Realty (DR) is expanding into subsidized housing by partnering with local government entities. DR uses Sales Cloud and has enabled field history tracking on the Opportunity object. Due to increased information requirements, the App Dev team is changing Text Area (Long) fields to Rich Text fields to allow for up to 1,000 characters and better descriptions.

Which two considerations should be made by the team? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC are correct

B&C 
B. Data loss may occur when changing custom field types: Changing the field type from Text Area (Long) to Rich Text may result in data loss if there are values in the existing Text Area (Long) fields that exceed the character limit of the new Rich Text fields. It's important to review and backup the data before making the change to ensure no critical information is lost.

C. Field History Tracking records value changes of 255 characters or less: Field History Tracking in Salesforce has a limitation where it can only track changes made to fields with a maximum length of 255 characters. If the Rich Text fields allow for more than 255 characters, any changes made to those fields beyond 255 characters will not be captured in the Field History Tracking.

Selected Answer: AB
Answer is A & B.

C- "Changes to fields with more than 255 characters are tracked AS EDITED, and their old and new values AREN’T RECORDED."

D- "Only the first 254 characters in a rich text area or a long text area are supported with the “contains” operator in a report filter."

C- https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?language=en_US&id=sf.field_audit_trail.htm&type=5
